metadata.title: Newcomb's Wildflower Guide - Identification Traits Ontology
metadata.description: Botanical trait vocabulary derived from Newcomb's Wildflower Guide identification key, with synonyms for cross-database matching. Extended with finer-grained subcategories for botanical precision.
metadata.newcombOriginalNote: Items marked 'newcombOriginal: true' are categories from Newcomb's original key. Nested subcategories without this flag are extensions for botanical precision.

Flower Symmetry and Parts.description: Symmetry type and number of petals or petal-like parts. Note: 'actinomorphic' (radial symmetry) and 'zygomorphic' (bilateral symmetry) describe symmetry type only, not petal count. The merosity terms (dimerous, trimerous, etc.) describe petal count only.

values.label: Irregular Flowers
values.description: Bilaterally symmetric flowers - can only be divided into mirror-image halves along one plane

values.label: 2 Regular Parts
values.description: Flowers with 2 petals or petal-like parts, radially arranged

values.label: 3 Regular Parts
values.description: Flowers with 3 petals or petal-like parts, radially arranged

values.label: 4 Regular Parts
values.description: Flowers with 4 petals or petal-like parts, radially arranged

values.label: 5 Regular Parts
values.description: Flowers with 5 petals or petal-like parts, radially arranged

values.label: 6 Regular Parts
values.description: Flowers with 6 petals or petal-like parts, radially arranged

values.label: 7 or More Regular Parts
values.description: Flowers with 7+ petals or petal-like parts, radially arranged

values.label: Parts Indistinguishable
values.description: Flower parts not clearly countable - often composite heads with many tiny florets

Growth Form.description: Overall growth habit of the plant

values.label: Wildflower
values.description: Herbaceous flowering plant - non-woody stem that dies back seasonally

values.label: Forb
values.description: Herbaceous plant excluding graminoids (grasses, sedges, rushes) - broad-leaved herbs

values.label: Graminoid
values.description: Grass-like herbaceous plants including true grasses, sedges, and rushes

values.label: Shrub
values.description: Woody plant with multiple stems from base, typically under 5m tall

values.label: True Shrub
values.description: Fully woody throughout, with persistent woody stems

values.label: Subshrub
values.description: Woody at base only, with herbaceous upper stems that may die back; intermediate between herb and shrub

values.label: Vine
values.description: Climbing or trailing plant that uses other structures for support or spreads along ground

values.label: Climbing Vine
values.description: Grows upward by attaching to or twining around supports

values.label: Trailing Vine
values.description: Spreads horizontally along ground without climbing

values.label: Liana
values.description: Woody climbing vine, typically of tropical or subtropical forests

Leaf Arrangement.description: Pattern of leaf attachment along the stem

values.label: No Apparent Leaves
values.description: Leaves absent or highly modified

values.label: Truly Leafless
values.description: Leaves completely absent

values.label: Reduced or Scale Leaves
values.description: Leaves present but highly modified to scales or greatly reduced in size

values.label: Basal Leaves Only
values.description: Leaves clustered at base of plant with no stem leaves

values.label: Alternate Leaves
values.description: One leaf per node, arranged in alternating pattern along stem

values.label: Distichous (Two-Ranked)
values.description: Leaves in two vertical rows on opposite sides of stem, 180° divergence angle

values.label: Spiral
values.description: Leaves arranged helically around stem, typically at golden angle (137.5°)

values.label: Opposite or Whorled Leaves
values.description: Two or more leaves arising from the same node

values.label: Opposite Leaves
values.description: Two leaves arising from the same node, on opposite sides of the stem

values.label: Simple Opposite
values.description: Two leaves at each node, opposite sides; successive pairs not necessarily at right angles

values.label: Decussate
values.description: Opposite leaves with successive pairs rotated 90° from each other, forming a cross pattern

values.label: Whorled Leaves
values.description: Three or more leaves arising from the same node, arranged in a circle
